title: Nadhim Zahawi – 2022 Comments on Boris Johnson Returning as Prime Minister
author: admin
summary: The comments made by Nadhim Zahawi, the Chancellor of the Duchy of Lancaster, on Twitter on 23 October 2022.
content:
I’m backing Boris. He got the big calls right, whether it was ordering more vaccines ahead of more waves of covid, arming Ukraine early against the advice of some, or stepping down for the sake of unity. But now, Britain needs him back. We need to unite to deliver on our manifesto.
  *[ERSA]: Employment Related Services Association
  *[HS2]: High Speed Two
  *[GPs]: general practitioners
  *[R+D]: research and development
  *[GVA]: gross value added - the measure of the value of goods and services produced in a sector
  *[CEOs]: chief executive officers
  *[OECD]: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development
  *[ESA]: Employment and Support Allowance
  *[
  ESA
 ]: Employment and Support Allowance
  *[EIF]: education inspection framework
  *[

 ]: joint targeted area inspections
  *[JTAIs]: joint targeted area inspections

  *[ILACS]: inspections of local authority children's services
  *[

  *[SEND]: special educational needs and/or disabilities
  *[EEF]: the Education Endowment Foundation
  *[DfE]: Department for education

  *[UNCLOS]: United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea
  *[ASEAN]: Association of Southeast Asian Nations
  *[Ofcom]: Office of Communications
  *[COLT]: City Of London Telecom
  *[4G]: fourth generation mobile network
  *[5G]: fifth generation mobile network
  *[DSIT]: Department for Science, Innovation and Technology
  *[Defra]: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs
  *[2G]: second generation mobile network
  *[3G]: third generation mobile network
  *[6G]: sixth generation mobile network
  *[ITU]: International Telecommunication Union
  *[R&D]: research and development
  *[OpenRAN]: Open Radio Access Networks
  *[ONE]: Open Network Ecosystem

When I was Chancellor, I saw a preview of what Boris 2.0 would look like. He was contrite and honest about his mistakes. He’d learned from those mistakes how he could run No 10 & the country better.
